title: Rear Brake Caliper - Removal

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Caution - Do not spill brake fluid
To prevent paint damage, do not spill brake fluid onto any area of the bodywork. Spilled brake fluid will damage paintwork.
Disconnect the rear brake hose at the caliper and place the free end of the hose in a suitable container to collect the brake fluid. Discard the sealing washers.
Release the fixing and remove the rear ABS wheel speed sensor. Collect the shim from between the sensor and brake anchor plate and discard the fixing.
Release the electrical cable for the ABS wheel speed sensor from the cable clip on the brake anchor plate.

body.name: Rear Caliper Hose and ABS Sensor

body.body: Rear ABS wheel speed sensor fixing
Note the position of the rear brake caliper for installation.
Remove the brake caliper and brake anchor plate.
